alert.note: Alert for Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 01 at 3:05PM PST until December 03 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. From 4 PM Friday to Sunday morning, additional snow accumulations 8 to 14 inches above 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Peola, Anatone, Mountain Road, and Cloverland Road. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions. Areas of blowing and drifting snow Saturday and Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
